ygData.subject: Re: Charisma effect on magic resists
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The question is, how often have you played the Carrilon?  I have close to the same dexterity as you, 110, and I never miss when starting the Carrilon, at
ygData.messageBody:
Talies the Wanderer wrote:

> From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
>
> At 09:23 PM 8/9/99 -0500, you wrote:
> >From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
> >
> >Very strange indeed. I may miss a note here and there, but not much. I
> >have absolutely no problem getting my songs started. Can't remember offhand
> >the exact number, but my dexterity is around 110 or so. I have a feeling
> >dexterity plays a bigger role in getting a song up and running, rather than
> >charisma. If everyone else has good dexterity and experiences this problem
> >I am mystified.
>
> Dex of 106, and I have to try at LEAST 5 times to get Carrilon going.
>

The question is, how often have you played the Carrilon? I have close to the
same dexterity as you, 110, and I never miss when starting the Carrilon, at least
not lately. I know when I first got the song, I used to miss quite a bit, but
that's like any song, the first while after you get it are murder for getting it
going.

I have used the Carrilon a LOT, between my smithing and buying steel plate and
getting oddball quests. I think that's a factor that shouldn't be overlooked.

Jyzan of Karana
